sub_title: Strategic Response Manager at Mercy Corps
summary:
International public health and development professional with over ten years of experience in Sub-Saharan Africa, Asia and the Caribbean. Proven leader practiced in cash and livelihoods program design and implementation, program quality control and remote monitoring, organizational capacity and systems building for staff and external stakeholders, resilience design and measurement, social behavior change research, and development and operationalization of monitoring and evaluation (M&E) plans, demonstrating analytical rigor and range of influence during and after complex crises.

Specialties: 
Resilience Programming and Resilience Measurement 
Operational Approches to Violence Prevention and Conflict Mitigation Programming
Social Behavior Change Strategy Development
Youth and Markets Programming

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Strategic Response Manager

profile_positions.description:

- Reviewed policies, procedures, and business model to ensure stable operations during uncertain socio-political and security environment, and ensured growth, safe implementation, and impact during COVID-19 pandemic

- Served as advisor on the Executive Committee and as Humanitarian Country Team representative for the Haiti Inter-NGO Liaison Framework (CLIO)

- Revised organizational structure to leverage local talent and develop a Haitian leadership pipeline, for which four Haitian colleagues were selected for Mercy Corps’ global leadership programs, two Haitian colleagues were transferred to expat positions, and one Haitian colleague was sent on Short-Term Assignment
